phrases.phrase:
The below SVG image background configuration is quite experimental. It has been tested with the following SVG browsers: Firefox, Chrome, Opera, IE 9 & 10. Here is the reference link which explains what were the problems to implement this background option.

First of all, this addon has two integration modes:
> with the TMS (template modifications system)
> with Javascript.

With TMS, the background pattern will work with all the browsers quoted above.
With the Javascript method, the background pattern will not work with Opera (v.12.11 Rev 1661). To avoid display problems and standardise background on Opera, the background image of the breadcrumb item will be automatically deleted (using a Javascript function).

Last thing: if you want this background configuration to work with IE9, you will have to install this addon: Browser Detection (Mobile/MSIE) .
Color of the hover arrow (If you activate the SVG arrow, this color will be used as the inner SVG arrow color). Background default color value: @breadcrumbItemCrumbHover.background-color
The border of arrows are not cross browsers. This options will delete any borders, even on Firefox. If you want to display clean borders on all modern browsers, use the SVG arrows solution.
This option will include the arrow part inside the item url.
Color of the normal arrow (If you activate the SVG arrow, this color will be used as the inner SVG arrow color). Background color default value: @breadcrumbItemCrumb.background-color

Color of the normal arrow - first item (If you activate the SVG arrow, this color will be used as the inner SVG arrow color). Background color default value: @breadcrumbItemFirstCrumb.background-color
Color of the normal arrow - last item (If you activate the SVG arrow, this color will be used as the inner SVG arrow color). Background default color value: @breadcrumbItemLastCrumb.background-color

These SVG Arrows will replace the XenForo Default Arrows. They will work in all modern browsers (old browsers will continue to display normal arrows). Use them for example to display a border to the arrows like on Firefox (which is in fact a bug).

This option will add a layer with a background image above the color layer. This option should be used if you want to do more than only display the arrow border. It's working in all modern browsers except Opera... See information below.
Add a layer with an image background to the SVG arrows
You MUST set a correct value for this option (do not put 'px').
The image link must be the FULL URL, otherwise it will not work with Opera!
You MUST set a correct value for this option (do not put 'px').
This option could also also be called the SVG Arrow Outer. It will display the lines of the SVG Arrows. Enter here which should be their border width. Default value: 1 (do not put px).
Default height (for XenForo Default Theme): 24 (do not put px).
This option will delete the image backgrounds of breadcrumb items if the bowers is not compatible with SVG (Javascript detection).
You can control here the opacity of the Color layer. From 0.1 to 1 (1 being not transparent).
You can control here the opacity of the Image layer. From 0.1 to 1 (1 being not transparent).
Default width (for XenForo Default Theme): 12 (do not put px).
